intro: Neolepisorus ovatus f. truncatus, commonly known as the truncated moss fern, is a variant of the species Neolepisorus ovatus. It is a small, epiphytic fern that typically grows on tree trunks or rocks in humid, shaded environments. The plant features delicate, lance-shaped leaves with a truncate (cut-off) tip, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its fronds are usually dark green and have a velvety texture. This fern is often found in tropical and subtropical regions where high humidity supports its growth.
